title: June, 2025
content: We will co-organize the Big Data and Machine Learning Systems Track Co-Chair of The 31st IEEE International Conference on Parallel and Distributed Systems (IEEE ICPADS 2025)! Please consider submitting your excellent work! ICPADS 2025 Website

title: June, 2025
content: We will co-organize the Inaugural ACM SIGSPATIAL Workshop on Spatial Intelligence for Smart and Connected Communities (SpatialConnect) in Minneapolis! Please consider submitting your excellent work! SpatialConnect 2025 Website

title: June, 2025
content: One paper about Network Robustness is accepted by IEEE TMC!

title: May, 2025
content: One paper about Multi-task Heterogeneous GNNs is accepted by KDD 2025 (ADS Track, acceptance rate: 21%)! Congratulations to Xinyue!

title: May, 2025
content: One paper about Uncertainty Calibration of LLM is accepted by ACL 2025 (Industry Track)! Congratulations to Zejun!

title: May, 2025
content: One paper about Edge-assisted Autonomous Driving is accepted by ACM Transactions on Embedded Computing Systems (TECS)!

title: May, 2025
content: Excited to share that my PhD student Lin's paper about human-centered ride-hailing got accepted by IJCAI 2025 (Human-Centred Artificial Intelligence Track, acceptance rate: 8%)! Congratulations to Lin!

title: May, 2025
content: Served on an NSF panel.

title: April, 2025
content: Excited to share that my PhD student Lin's paper about AI-enabled Post-Disaster Power Restoration got accepted by IJCAI 2025 (AI and Social Good Track, acceptance rate: 18.5%)! Congratulations to Lin!

title: April, 2025
content: Honored to receive the CS Department Faculty Research Award! Grateful to be the sole recipient this year. Many thanks to our department for the continued support!

title: April, 2025
content: Honored to receive the Dean's Travel Award!

title: April, 2025
content: Excited to share that my PhD student Lin won the Research Presentation Award Runner-up at CS Expo 2025! Congratulations to Lin.

title: April, 2025
content: Served on an NSF panel.

title: March, 2025
content: I am honored to deliver a spotlight talk about AI for Sustainability at FSU's Collaborative Collision, an interdisciplinary networking event hosted by the FSU Research Development.

title: March, 2025
content: I am honored to receive the FSU/AWS Computer Support Seed Fund! Many thanks to the VPR office and AWS!

title: February, 2025
content: Honored to join the Editorial Board of Proceedings of the ACM on Interactive, Mobile, Wearable and Ubiquitous Technologies (IMWUT) as an Associate Editor!

title: December, 2024
content: Excited to share my PhD student Rongchao's paper about trajectory data generation was accepted by SDM! Congratulations to Rongchao!

title: December, 2024
content: Our project about privacy-preserving Generative AI has been awarded by the NSF-led National Artificial Intelligence Research Resource Pilot (NAIRR).

title: December, 2024
content: One paper got accepted by AAAI 2025.

title: December, 2024
content: Excited to join the Institute for Successful Longevity as a faculty affiliate. Looking forward to collaborating on AI for healthcare.

title: November, 2024
content: One paper about human knowledge-enhanced AI got accepted by ACM KDD 2025.

title: November, 2024
content: Invited to give a talk for FSU Data Science program students.

content: One paper got accepted by ACM SIGCHI Conference on Computer-Supported Cooperative Work & Social Computing (ACM CSCW).

content: Two papers got accepted by ACM SIGSPATIAL 2024.

content: Glad to give a talk about AI for Sustainability for Tallahassee high school students.

content: Three papers are accepted by ACM CIKM 2024

title: June, 2024
content: Honored to give a talk at UND's Distinguished Webinar in AI/Cybersecurity

title: June, 2024
content: One paper about large-scale graph data mining is accepted by 50th International Conference on Very Large Databases (VLDB 2024)

title: June, 2024
content: One paper about fairness-aware urban sensing is accepted by The 21st IEEE International Conference on Mobile Ad-Hoc and Smart Systems (IEEE MASS 2024)

content: Our sustainability project is featured on the FSU homepage. Sustainable Solutions

content: Invited to serve on an NSF Panel.

content: Invited to serve on an NSF Panel.

title: May, 2024
content: One paper about Behavior-Aware Coordinates Mining is accepted by IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering (TKDE). Excellent work.

title: May, 2024
content: Two papers are accepted by ACM KDD. One is about Mobility Data Privacy Risk and another is about Link Prediction in Billion-Scale Commercial Heterogeneous Graphs. Excellent work.

title: April, 2024
content: Congratulations to my PhD student Tonmoy for successfully passing his Prospectus Defense and also winning the Outstanding TA Award! Excellent research and teaching achievements!

title: April, 2024
content: I gave a guest lecture in FAMU-FSU College of Engineering. Thank Dr. Guo for the invitation!

title: April, 2024
content: Our project in collaboration with Rutgers and UCLA was funded by NSF (my role: FSU PI). Many thanks to the NSF and our fabulous team!

title: April, 2024
content: Our paper about community map generation was accepted to ACM IMWUT/UbiComp. Excellent work. One of my favorite papers. Many Thanks to Zhiqing!

title: April, 2024
content: Congratulations to my graduate student David for successfully defending his thesis. Excellent work on vehicle dispatching and redeployment for Emergency Medical Services with Reinforcement Learning.

title: April, 2024
content: My undergraduate student Judah presents our EV project at the FSU Undergraduate Research Symposium. Excellent work.

title: March, 2024
content: I attended the NSF Aspiring CPS PIs' Workshop and PI meeting. Thank NSF for providing this great opportunity. Wonderful experience.

title: Feb, 2024
content: I attended the NSF S&CC PI meeting. Thank NSF for providing this great opportunity. Wonderful experience.

title: January, 2024
content: Our paper finally got accepted by Nature Cities after a very long journey. This is the major project I did at MIT. This is also my first paper to be published in a Nature journal. Very excited for the new start! A great thanks to Shenhao, Yunhan, Taka, Esteban, and Sandy. The great team, Cheers.

title: January, 2024
content: Honored to receive the UROP Materials Grant funding.

title: December, 2023
content: One paper on Offline Reinforcement Learning is accepted by AAAI'24. This is the first work to develop Offline RL for large-scale order dispatching problems.

title: December, 2023
content: One paper on Time-Constrained Actor-Critic Reinforcement Learning is accepted to IEEE TMC.

title: November, 2023
content: Invited to serve on the NSF Panel.

title: November, 2023
content: Glad to hear that my Curricular Request for Data Science for Smart Cities has been approved by UCC and assigned an official course number CAP5795 after about one year with several rounds of revision. This course will be the first Data Science for Smart Cities course offered in Florida. Looking forward to witnessing the impact at the State University System of Florida.

title: October, 2023
content: One paper about UQ is accepted to TGL@NeurIPS as one of the four long Spotlight Papers (Best Paper Candidate) for a 20-minute presentation.

content: One paper is accepted to IEEE TMC.

content: My undergraduate student Judah Alter was funded by the FSU UROP (Undergraduate Research Opportunity Program).

content: Four papers on Smart Cities are accepted by ACM CIKM.

content: Our EV project is funded by the Sustainability & Climate Solutions Grant Program with $150,000. Thank Florida State University Office of the President and our Great team.

title: April, 2022
content: I will be joining the Department of Computer Science at Florida State University as a tenure-track assistant professor in 2022 Fall. I am looking for motivated Ph.D. and M.S. students, and undergraduate researchers. If you are interested, please email me with a copy of your CV to start a conversation.

title: December, 2021
content: Our paper about using Reinforcement Learning for instant delivery received the Outstanding Paper Award from IEEE RTSS 2021.
